name: Broadway Musicals In Hollywood Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played the lead (Tevye) in the movie version of 'Fiddler on the Roof'?
questions.explanation:
Topol.

	Good job, too. Bernardi (and Mostel, too, I think) played Tevye. Kiley did 'Man of La Mancha'.

questions.text: A classic moment in 'Gigi' is the singing of 'Thank Heaven for Little Girls'. Who sings it in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Maurice Chevalier.

	The song is closely associated with him. Harrison did My Fair Lady.(Actually, it was originally a stage play (but not a musical).

questions.text: Who played the irresistible Lola in the movie version of 'Damn Yankees'?
questions.explanation:
Gwen Verdon.

	Verdun the versatile. Gaynor did 'South Pacific'; Martin did just about everything. Caron did Gigi.

questions.text: Another classic moment: 'sit down - you're rocking the boat' (from Guys and Dolls). Who sang it in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Stubby Kaye.

	He also did a nice turn on 'Jubilation T Cornpone' in 'Lil Abner'.

questions.text: Who played Dick Van Dyke's romantic interest (Rosie) in 'Bye Bye Birdie'?
questions.explanation:
Janet Leigh.

	She wasn't in many musicals. Ann-Margret was a young girl in the movie. Shirley Jones did 'Oklahoma!'.

questions.text: The movie version of 'West Side Story' was enhanced by the gymnastic skills of the actor who played Riff:
questions.explanation:
Russ Tamblyn.

	Amazing somersaults - which I believe he also did in 'Seven Brides for Seven Brothers'. Kerr was in 'South Pacific'; the others were in 'West Side Story.'

questions.text: Another classic moment: the singing of 'Old Man River' in 'Showboat', sung by:
questions.explanation:
Paul Robeson.

	It became HIS song. Brynner was in 'King and I'. MacRae was 'Oklahoma!'. Keel was in 'Showboat' and 'Seven Brides for Seven Brothers.'

questions.text: This actor earned a well-deserved Oscar for a great performance as the Master of Ceremonies in 'Cabaret'
questions.explanation:
Joel Grey.

	His best work. York had a non-singing role in the movie. Preston was in 'Music Man;' Walston was in 'Damn Yankees' and 'South Pacific.'

questions.text: The female lead in the movie version of 'The King and I':
questions.explanation:
Deborah Kerr.

	Another nice job. Merman, of course, did many other roles.

questions.text: The role of 'Mame' went to this actress in the musical movie version of that show:
questions.explanation:
Lucille Ball.

	Lansbury did it on Broadway. Movie was a bomb. Channing and Bailey were in 'Hello Dolly' (Show).
